thread.title: Jones' four TDs lift Colerain past Fairfield, 35-0
thread.title_full: Jones' four TDs lift Colerain past Fairfield, 35-0

title: Jones' four TDs lift Colerain past Fairfield, 35-0
text:
Jones' four TDs lift Colerain past Fairfield, 35-0 Colerain quarterback Deshaunte Jones discusses the Cardinals' 35-0 win against Fairfield on Friday night. Mike Dyer , mdyer@enquirer.com 10:09 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Buy Photo Colerain quarterback Deshaunte Jones sprints upfield on a big gain in the first quarter during the high school football game between the Colerain Cardinals and the Fairfield Indians, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015, at Fairfield Stadium in Fairfield, Ohio. (Photo: The Enquirer/Kareem Elgazzar) Buy Photo 22 CONNECT 31 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
When Deshaunte Jones has the football and there is real estate ahead – look out. 
The Colerain senior quarterback exhibited that again Friday night at Fairfield. Jones had four rushing touchdowns as the Cardinals defeated the Indians, 35-0. 
Jones had 12 carries for 149 net rushing yards for the game. 
“Deshaunte doesn’t need much,” Colerain coach Tom Bolden said. “When he gets in open space that’s all she wrote.” 
Colerain schedule, stats 
Jones leapt into the end zone for the first touchdown of the night early in the second quarter after a nifty 30-yard run. He also had a 70-yard touchdown run in the third quarter among his highlights. 
Jones was all smiles after the game. He didn’t plan for the leap into the end zone. It just happened. But, that’s the way the night went for him and the Cardinals, ranked No. 1 in The Enquirer Division I area coaches’ poll.
